content.data: Delete A Part
The Delete A Part UCS type is very powerful. Let's say for example you would like to delete the Tops in Sink Base cabinets. Follow along with this topic to find out how.
Click on the New option in the User Created Standard window.
General Tab
The General Tab is where you enter the Name and select the Type of UCS you would like to create.
image97.png

Enter a Name for the UCS. (Delete Tops on Sink Base Cabinets) 
 
 
 For Type select Delete A Part. 
 
 
 From the list to the right select the Top part. 
 
 
 Click Next to go to the next step in the Delete A Part UCS Wizard.
Enter a Name for the UCS. (Delete Tops on Sink Base Cabinets)
Enter a Name for the UCS. (Delete Tops on Sink Base Cabinets)
For Type select Delete A Part.
For Type select Delete A Part.
From the list to the right select the Top part.
From the list to the right select the Top part.
Click Next to go to the next step in the Delete A Part UCS Wizard.
Click Next to go to the next step in the Delete A Part UCS Wizard.
Assembly Class Tab
image98.png

Select Base for Assembly Class Type. 
 
 
 Click Next to go to the next step in the Modify A Part UCS Wizard.
Select Base for Assembly Class Type.
Select Base for Assembly Class Type.
Click Next to go to the next step in the Modify A Part UCS Wizard.
Click Next to go to the next step in the Modify A Part UCS Wizard.
Assembly Properties Tab
image99.png

Type in SB* as the Assembly Name. Since I name all my Sink Bases with SB as the leading characters this is all I need to do to activate this UCS for my Sink Base Cabinets. 
 
 
 Click Next to go to the next step in the Modify A Part UCS Wizard.
Type in SB* as the Assembly Name. Since I name all my Sink Bases with SB as the leading characters this is all I need to do to activate this UCS for my Sink Base Cabinets.
Type in SB* as the Assembly Name. Since I name all my Sink Bases with SB as the leading characters this is all I need to do to activate this UCS for my Sink Base Cabinets.
Click Next to go to the next step in the Modify A Part UCS Wizard.
Click Next to go to the next step in the Modify A Part UCS Wizard.
End Type Tab
The End Type Tab allows you to filter out based on certain Cabinet End Types. In this example we are not going to specify any End Types.
image100.png
Since we are not going to Filter based on End Types simply click Next.
Since we are not going to Filter based on End Types simply click Next.
Since we are not going to Filter based on End Types simply click Next.
Construction Methods Tab
The Construction Methods Tab allows you to filter out based on certain Construction Methods. In this example we are not going to specify any Construction Methods.
image101.png
Since we are not going to Filter based on Construction Methods simply click Next.
Since we are not going to Filter based on Construction Methods simply click Next.
Since we are not going to Filter based on Construction Methods simply click Next.
Top Conditions Tab
This Tab would allow us to specify certain Conditions the Top must meet for this UCS to activate. Since we want it to always activate on Sink Base cabinets we would not need to enter anything here.
image102.png

Since we are not going to Filter based on Top Conditions simply click Next. 
 
 
 Click Finish to finish the UCS.
Since we are not going to Filter based on Top Conditions simply click Next.
Since we are not going to Filter based on Top Conditions simply click Next.
Click Finish to finish the UCS.
Click Finish to finish the UCS.
This is how to create a basic Delete Part/Operation UCS.
